title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau combined for 39 goals in the college hockey season at Boston College.
Hagens, a top 2025 NHL Draft pick, has 39 points in 29 games, with increased performance playing wing.
Letourneau, acquired in a trade, emerged from a scoreless freshman season to 19 goals in his sophomore year.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An unnamed NBA assistant coach reportedly believes the Boston Celtics are the favorite to win the Eastern Conference.
The Celtics are second in the East, 5.5 games behind the Detroit Pistons, with a 39-20 record this season.
Boston leads in net rating since Thanksgiving, with key players like Jaylen Brown averaging over 29 points per game.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre in Boston on February 27, 2026.
The setlist included hits like 'It Gets Easier' and 'Cover Me Up' along with Drive-By Truckers covers.
The band's performance mixed Americana, Southern rock, and folk, featuring solos from guitarist Sadler Vaden.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are unlikely to acquire standout edge rushers Trey Hendrickson, Jaelan Phillips, or Odafe Oweh due to market pricing.
Las Vegas Raiders are not rushing to trade Maxx Crosby despite speculation and a reported asking price of two first-round picks.
The Patriots, with $40 million cap space, might target edge rushers in the draft, eyeing prospects like Missouri's Zion Young.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance is set to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS may integrate sports coverage, potentially expanding MLB, NHL, and college football on CBS.
Netflix exits WBD bidding, maintaining NFL rights through 2033, eyeing future broadcast deals including CBS's NFL package.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are interested in acquiring A.J. Brown, but view the Eagles' asking price as too high.
Trading A.J. Brown would cost the Eagles significant dead money, complicating potential trade negotiations with the Patriots.
Patriots may consider restructuring Stefon Diggs' contract to accommodate Brown, who has a $7.04 million cap hit if traded.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts is transitioning from E-ZPass transponders to RFID-based windshield sticker tags starting Sunday.
The new E-ZPass stickers cost 55 cents each, significantly cheaper than the $6.70 transponders, saving $7.4 million annually.
Stickers are free for customers, with no action needed for those currently using transponders as they remain functional.

title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jean Brito, 47, of Woburn, pleaded not guilty to 10 charges of tax evasion and filing false returns.
Prosecutors allege Brito underreported $20 million in business income, evading $1.2 million in personal taxes since 2018.
State Police and FBI agents found $35,000 in cash and documents at Brito's Woburn home and Medford business.

title: Beware the birds: Bird flu confirmed in Boston
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Bird flu has been confirmed in Boston's Emerald Necklace park system, sparking a public health advisory from local officials.
The Boston Public Health Commission states the risk to humans is low, advising against contact with wildlife.
CDC reports 71 U.S. bird flu cases since 2024, with symptoms similar to seasonal flu and two fatalities.

title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza expressed excitement about potentially being mentored by Tom Brady at the Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, a standout QB from Indiana, completed a pre-draft interview with the Raiders and hopes to meet Brady in person.
Projected as the No. 1 overall pick, Mendoza led the NCAA with 41 touchdowns, a 72% completion rate, and a 182.9 passer rating.
